titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Leopold Tyrmand Papers, 1941-1985
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Zbigniew L. Stanczyk; machine-readable finding aid created by Brooke Dykman Dockter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-10-24T11:45-0700

did.abstract: Writings, diaries, correspondence, notes, and printed matter, relating to social conditions in Poland, cultural conditions in communist countries, popular culture in the United States and other Western countries, standards of sexual behavior in the United States, and American conservative thought. Includes fictional writings.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Leopold Tyrmand Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1986.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Student, Department of Architecture, L'Academie des Beaux-Arts, Paris
Wilno, Soviet occupied zone, arrested and sentenced for 25 years for political activities
Published first essays, New Yorker Magazine
Lecturer, Slavic Literature Department, Columbia University
Editor, Kultura Essays, Explorations in Freedom

Appointed Vice-President, Rockford College
Edits, Rockford Papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Personal documents, identification documents, curricula vitae, notes, correspondence, clippings, brochures, fliers, tickets, business cards, bank statements, invoices, awards, prizes, and other printed matter arranged chronologically by topic or physical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notebooks, manuscripts, typescripts, daily occurence books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manuscripts and typescripts describing retrospective events, literary ideas, thoughts, arranged by physical and topical form

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Incoming correspondence arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts and printed copies of articles, reviews, essays, chapters, books, with related correspondence, notes, proofs, contracts, correspondence, and other material, arranged chronologically by date of publication

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts and printed copies of speeches, with related notes arranged chronologically by date of presentation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes, notebooks, correspondence, magazines, pamphlets, programs, and other printed matter arranged alphabetically by topic

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous collection of Polish emigre newspapers
